description: Construction of a two storey detached residential building with habitable roofspace, containing one one-bedroom self contained flat and one two-bedroom self contained flat, provision of two car parking spaces, refuse storage and associated landscaping amenity space
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title/numbers DONC/PL03 received 18th July 2012, DONC/PL04B received 12th September 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces (including windows), of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details. REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance withsection 6, 7 and 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The design of the building shall comply with the standards of the Secured By Design award before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:	To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in the interests of the safety of the residents and visitors, in accordance with section 6 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2011, policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, adopted SPG 8: 'Safer Ealing' and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | Details of the new planting and any other soft/hard landscaping works proposed shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development and these works shall be completed prior to the first ocucpation of he dwellinghouse hereby permitted. Any trees or shrubs which within the five years of planting die, are removed or become seriously damage or diseased  shall be replaced within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed with the local planning authority.  REASON:	In the interest of the visual amenity of the area and to assist providing a suitable setting for the dwelling and screeening from neighbouring prooperties, in pursuance to the objectives of section 6 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London plan 2011, policies 4.1, 4.5 and  5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'The Plan for the Environment' 2004 and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The details of the boundary treatments of the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining and future occupiers of the site and  the visual amenities of the  surrounding area in accordance with with the objectives of policies 7.1 and 7.4 of the London plan 2011, policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's Adopted Uniary Development Plan 'The Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1  of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | Life Home Standards  The units hereby approved shall comply with Lifetime Home Standards  REASON:	To ensure appropriate access for people with disabilities in accordance with section 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework of the policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the SPG7 'Accessible Ealing' and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The off street car parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be made available prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with section 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy.
